JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Ineta Ziemele;Krzysztof Wojtyczek;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr Vadims Starovoitovs , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in Rīga .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , who was succeeded by Agent Mrs. PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was remanded in custody , suspected of having committed a number of robberies .

CARDINAL . On DATE , before ORG , the applicant pleaded guilty and , in a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , the court convicted the applicant and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The applicant submitted an appeal , which he later withdrew . The judgment of the lower court came into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant states that in DATE , when his detention order was adopted , he informed the judge that prior to his arrest he had worked for DATE as a security guard in a private company . He asked to be placed in special detention facilities for former members of law - enforcement institutions . The judge dismissed his request because he was not able to prove that he had been employed by ORG .
CARDINAL . After his arrival at FAC , and later in FAC , he informed the prison guards about his former employment .

CARDINAL . On DATE his cellmates in FAC found out about his former employment and therefore , after a conflict in the cell , the applicant was transferred to another cell . After other cellmates had found out about the applicant ’s previous employment , and also the fact that , according to informal rules in the prison , he had the lowest “ social status ” ( “ левый ” as stated by the applicant ) during TIME DATE he was ill - treated by them and in the morning he was transferred to another cell . On DATE he was again transferred because his cellmates had refused to share a cell with an inmate of the lowest social status .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to FAC and placed in a common cell with other inmates . He states that during DATE and DATE he wrote several letters to ORG FAC raising doubts about his safety in the prison , but that no measures were taken . In DATE ORG dismissed a request submitted by the applicant ’s mother for him to be transferred to another prison .
CARDINAL . At ORG request , ORG provided the following information , supported by copies of letters and decisions .
CARDINAL . From DATE to DATE the applicant was held in detention in FAC in GPE . When the final judgment in the applicant ’s criminal case took effect he was transferred to FAC .

CARDINAL . NORP On CARDINAL and DATE the applicant and his mother asked ORG to transfer the applicant to a prison in ORG . The requests were motivated by the family situation , namely the mother ’s poor health and the fact that the applicant had little opportunity to see his wife and child . In DATE ORG dismissed the request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG about , inter alia , the potential threats he would face if other inmates found out about his former employment with a security company .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant and his mother repeatedly asked ORG to transfer the applicant to PERSON or FAC in GPE . In addition to the reasons previously given , they cited the fact that the applicant had worked in a security company and therefore feared that other inmates might find out . The applicant stated , inter alia , that at the moment he was keeping the situation in his cell under control , but he feared that the situation might change after his transfer to a less lenient prison regime where he would have to share the common areas with other inmates .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked the security company to provide information about the applicant . On DATE ORG informed the applicant ’s mother that once the details of the applicant ’s previous employment with a security company had been established , the applicant ought to be transferred to specialised detention facilities intended for former members of law - enforcement establishments in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the head of ORG of ORG , having analysed the information that from DATE until DATE the applicant had been employed by a security company , decided that for security reasons the applicant should be transferred to ORG in GPE . That decision was put into effect on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the murder of an inmate at FAC , members of ORG special forces unit began a search of all the cells in FAC . During the search , the inmates were ordered to leave their cells and gather in the prison yard .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , the inmates were ordered to wait in an uncomfortable position for TIME in direct sunlight . All attempts to move resulted in the officers kicking the inmates and beating them with batons . After the search , the applicant returned to his cell , where everything had been turned upside down and some of his belongings were missing .
CARDINAL . On DATE he asked ORG administration to explain on what basis special measures were being used against him . He also asked for his missing belongings to be returned .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained about the search to ORG , and asked it to investigate the lawfulness of the measures used by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor informed the applicant that his complaint had been forwarded to ORG and that he would be informed of the results of the investigation in due course .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant the administration of ORG offered to transfer the applicant to another prison in Rīga in exchange for the applicant withdrawing his previous complaints about FAC . In a letter dated DATE the applicant informed ORG that he had settled the matter with ORG administration , which had compensated him for his lost belongings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again complained to ORG about the search on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that ORG had not found any violations by members of the special forces unit during the search on DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the information ORG and the prosecutor ’s office had provided to ORG , after the search carried out by the special forces unit in ORG , several inmates complained that the special forces had inflicted bodily injuries on them and that the medical unit had failed to provide prompt medical assistance . During the internal investigation launched by ORG it was established that on DATE of the search CARDINAL inmates had asked for medical assistance and DATE inmates had done so . The applicant was not among them .

CARDINAL . In his letter of CARDINAL DATE addressed to the prosecutor ’s office ( a copy of which has been provided by the ORG ) the applicant described the situation in ORG during the search . He stated that he had observed from the window of his cell intolerable behaviour by members of the special forces unit and officers of FAC . He also stated that he and his cellmates had voluntarily obeyed the orders given by the special unit but those who had disobeyed had been beaten and kicked . In general the applicant asked ORG to investigate the activities of all those who had participated in the search .

CARDINAL . On DATE inmates ( the applicant not being among them ) submitted complaints to the prosecutor ’s office concerning the activities of the special forces unit , and asked for criminal proceedings to be instituted . In DATE the prosecutor ’s office dismissed the complaints but on DATE , at the ORG ’s request , the latter decision was quashed and criminal proceedings were instituted . At the time the Government observations were submitted the investigation was still ongoing .
